questions.text: A train travels 300 km at a speed of 75 km/h. How much time does it take?
questions.explanation:
Given: Distance = 300 km, Speed = 75 km/h

Using formula: Time = Distance / Speed

Time = 300 / 75
Time = 4 hours

Therefore, the train takes 4 hours to travel 300 km at 75 km/h.

questions.text: Two cars are 150 km apart and moving towards each other at speeds of 40 km/h and 35 km/h. After how much time will they meet?
questions.explanation:
Given: Distance = 150 km, Speed₁ = 40 km/h, Speed₂ = 35 km/h
Moving towards each other (opposite directions)

Relative Speed = Speed₁ + Speed₂
Relative Speed = 40 + 35 = 75 km/h

Time to meet = Distance / Relative Speed
Time = 150 / 75
Time = 2 hours

Therefore, the two cars will meet after 2 hours.

questions.text: A boat covers 40 km downstream in 4 hours and 30 km upstream in 5 hours. What is the speed of the boat in still water?
questions.explanation:
Given: Downstream = 40 km in 4 hours, Upstream = 30 km in 5 hours

Step 1: Find downstream and upstream speeds
Downstream speed = 40/4 = 10 km/h
Upstream speed = 30/5 = 6 km/h

Step 2: Find boat speed in still water
Boat speed = (Downstream speed + Upstream speed) / 2
Boat speed = (10 + 6) / 2
Boat speed = 16 / 2
Boat speed = 8 km/h

Verification:
Stream speed = (10 - 6) / 2 = 2 km/h
Downstream = 8 + 2 = 10 km/h ✓
Upstream = 8 - 2 = 6 km/h ✓

Therefore, the speed of the boat in still water is 8 km/h.
